title: Drew Barrymore's ex Will Kopelman with daughters in NYC | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 124 shares Olive matched her little sister in a pink puffy jacket as well with a fur color along the hood. She looked cute in white tights and ruby red Dorthy-like slippers. Pretty in pink: Daughter Frankie, two, who was sitting inside the stroller, had on a puffy jacket and thick boots to keep warm in the cool New York temperatures Co-ordinated cuties: Olive, four, matched her little sister in a pink puffy jacket as well with a fur color along the hood Will was seen walking beside a female companion who wore a black coat with fur detailing around the hood. She wore black skinny jeans and light sneakers while holding a backpack on one shoulder. Drew recently posted a photo of her daughter with Will, while he participated in a Women's March, proving they are still close for the sake of their offspring. 'Proud of my daughter and her dad,' she wrote in the Instagram caption. Good terms! Drew, 41, recently posted a photo of her daughter with Will, while he participated in a Women's March He had on a cap and sunglasses while her girl was in pink. Her sign read: 'I like unicorns. And reproductive health care. For all.' And the Santa Clarita diet star has also remained close with Will's family when she shared an image of his in-laws at a march as well. Her caption read: 'This is my family. Grammy @cocokopelman and Aunty @jillkargman cousins Fletch and @ivykargman. One big, happy family! The Santa Clarita diet star has also remained close with Will's family when she shared an image of his in-laws at a Woman's March as well The activist continued: 'But most of all, the fact that Ivy made a sign with something I said, well, I might be the most proud I have ever been. My life has been a straight line to learn from women. Follow them. And celebrate them. Tell stories for them. And above all, be inspired by them. 'Let's let this fire burn brighter every day and do not let it fade. Let's take it all the way! We owe it to everyone who has already fought for dignity and freedom. Let's show all the girls that to become a women is the most powerful thing! 'But I also thank all the men who stood with us. This was about equal rights after all and for all.' Daughter's advocate: Drew participated in the Woman's March last month as a voice for her young daughters Drew recently admitted that her divorced was 'worst nightmare' come true. The actress - who was emancipated from her parents at the age of 14 and was largely estranged from her father John until his death in 2004 - found her marriage split particularly hard because it shattered all her dreams of giving daughters Olive, four, and two-year-old Frankie an 'ultra-traditional' upbringing. She said: 'It was just like my worst nightmare. I so wanted to raise kids in this ultra-traditional way and do everything so the polar opposite of my experience.' However, she's trying hard to 'figure out' how best to raise her children in the new situation and for her and Will to still raise them with the right values and allow them to feel 'safe'. Short marriage: Drew and Will were married for four years before deciding to part ways She told talk show host Ellen DeGeneres: 'It really is about the tone you set and you can talk until you're blue in the face but kids watch what you do every single day of your life, all day long, and that behaviour and that example and that love and community and honesty is just, I think what's making everything feel safe for my kids. 'And that's really the intention I had as a parent, was how do my kids have this incredible sense of like, freedom inside their heart, because they know I've got them and their dad's got them and the [rest of their family]. 'I got two families. I went from like, zero to two and it's a miracle and a blessing and we do it in a way that I think a lot of other people are probably doing it too and sometimes, again, the road is different than what you tried to make it or what you expected and you just figure it out and figure it out with grace.' Drew and Will were married for four years before deciding to part ways. The actress has had a busy year already, promoting her new Netflix series Santa Clarita diet alongside co-star Timothy Olyphant. She stars as a wife and mother who also happens to be a zombie who feeds on human flesh. Working mom!
